snippet: A Federal judge here today forbade  the Clinton Administration to carry out a plan to punish doctors who  recommend marijuana to their patients under a new California law.     In issuing a preliminary injunction, the judge, Fern M. Smith of Federa...
lead_paragraph: A Federal judge here today forbade the Clinton Administration to carry out a plan to punish doctors who recommend marijuana to their patients under a new California law. In issuing a preliminary injunction, the judge, Fern M. Smith of Federal District Court, ruled that if the Government tried to prosecute doctors who endorsed marijuana's medical uses, it would encroach on their First Amendment rights to free speech.
abstract: Federal Judge Fern M Smith rules that Clinton Administration cannot carry out plan to punish doctors who recommend marijuana to their patients under new California law (S)

headline.main: U.S. Threat Over Drug Is Lifted in California
